majority = Jacksonian |sessionnumber3 =Special (Senate) |sessionstart3 = March
4, 1829 |sessionend3 = March 17, 1829 |sessionnumber1 = 1st [http://clerk.house.gov/art_history/house_history/bioguide-
front/21.pdf 21st Congress] from the Office of the Clerk website
|sessionstart1 = December 7, 1829 |sessionend1 = May 31, 1830 |sessionnumber2 =
2nd |sessionstart2 = December 6, 1830 |sessionend2 = March 3, 1831 |previous =
20th |next = 22nd }} The 'Twenty-first United States Congress' was a meeting of
the legislative branch of the United States federal government, consisting of
the United States Senate and the United States House of Representatives. It met
in Washington, D.C. from March 4, 1829 to March 4, 1831, during the first two
years of Andrew Jackson's presidency. The apportionment of seats in the House of
Representatives was based on the Fourth Census of the United States in 1820.
Both chambers had a Jacksonian majority.
